summary: Medicare spent nearly $28 billion in 2019 on short-term care for 1.5 million beneficiaries in skilled nursing facilities after hospital stays. Research indicates low nurse staffing can lead to potentially preventable re-hospitalizations. We found most facilities had a registered nurse on site 8 hours a day, as required. A federal study identified the nurse staffing levels needed to avoid care quality problems, but only 1...
title: Medicare: Additional Reporting on Key Staffing Information and Stronger Payment Incentives Needed for Skilled Nursing Facilities [Reissued with revisions on Aug. 10, 2021.]
